DEFECT SEGMENTATION

A multi-model AI architecture integrating deep learning-based segmentation models for crack and spalling detection, along with geometric deformation analysis of pantograph contact strips. Three specialized models operate concurrently to detect defects in compliance with ISO 1101:2017.

AR VISUALIZATION

Develop an augmented reality interface (Unity + Meta Quest Pro) overlaying virtual elements to assist in real-time pantograph contact strip inspection, integrating a segmentation API for real-time defect visualization, as well as an RLHF component in the form of a questionnaire.

RL FEEDBACK

Enhance reinforcement learning feedback loop enabling dynamic adaptation to new defect patterns through expert annotations. Implement continuous model improvement mechanism reducing false positives and increasing detection accuracy over time.

SYSTEM FUSION

integrates all segmentation models using Dempster-Shafer evidence theory for robust multi-modal decision-making. The complete pipeline orchestrates scan acquisition, defect segmentation, diagnostic fusion, AR visualization, RLHF feedback, and automated PDF reporting.

Augmented Reality and Reinforcement
Learning for High-Speed Train Maintenance

SIANA/ENSAM

CONTEXT

Pantograph contact strips require Level-2 inspection every 18 days (45 min/component) to detect wear, corrosion, cracks, and geometric deviations per ISO 1101:2017 standards. Current manual methods cause extended downtime (>12h/trainset), exhibit high measurement variability (±15-20%), and require expertise. Existing AR/AI solutions lack closed-loop adaptive learning, real-time multi-modal fusion, and field validation

Objective

Design an AI-based inspection framework integrating reinforcement learning feedback mechanisms, augmented reality visualization tools, and real-time detection, using pantograph contact strip inspection as a scalable use case for railway maintenance.

METHODOLOGY

Our research framework is structured around four complementary technical modules
